title: From the new Sambas to the best shoes for a soggy run – 64 trainers to tick every box
description: Want to know the best way to keep your kicks clean? Looking for a comfy pair that aren’t gross? We’ve got all your trainer questions answeredI bet you know very few people who don’t own a single pair of trainers. Even the most cursory glance at people’s feet on the street, in the office or, occasionally, on a red carpet (Spike Lee is never not in his Air Jordans) is proof that they have transcended their original purpose.But does that mean it’s OK to wear them to work – and if so, which ones? Does wearing black or white ones show your age, as much perhaps as how you wear your socks? What should you actually wear to run in – and, most burning of all, what is the new Adidas Samba in this post-Rishi world (clue: there’s more than one)? Continue reading...

title: The Best Red Carpet Looks At The 2025 SAG Awards — So Far
description: Awards season is rapidly coming to its end (T-minus one week until Hollywood’s biggest night — the Oscars!), which means red carpet lovers need to soak in as much sartorial inspiration as we can. And thankfully, the 2025 SAG Awards delivered on all fronts. Arguably one of awards season’s most fun ceremonies — or at least a fave for many celebs — the SAG Awards are all about the actors, with awards focusing solely on TV and film actors and winners decided by their peers. Taking to the navy carpet (accented with a gold background, show streamer Netflix’s background of choice), celebrities leaned into the power of an LBD (or suit), with stars like Elle Fanning, Lilly Singh, and Baby Reindeer’s Jessica Gunning donning a variety of black ball gowns. Shōgun star (and Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series nominee) Anna Sawai, Bridgerton actress Hannah Dodd, and XO, Kitty lead Anna Cathcart popped in stunning shades of red. Does this mean we should be expecting a LBD takeover for next week’s Oscars? Only time — and celeb stylists’ Instagram feeds — will tell. In the meantime, here are our best-dressed looks of the SAG Awards — so far. We'll keep updating through the night.Anna SawaiAnna Sawai in Armani Privé. title: London Fashion Week Street Style Will Refresh Your Approach to Transitional Dressing
description: Another New York Fashion Week has come and gone, but fashion month goes. The dressed-up festivities have now arrived at London Fashion Week, with fall/winter 2025 shows running from February 20 to 24 — and so have hoards of editors, content creators, models, designers, and industry insiders equipped with their best street style looks. The London crowd is putting their spin on some of the year’s top trends, and adapting for rainy weather when they have to. Experimental takes on capes, suiting, and bold, colorful maximalist looks are taking over the city’s streets, providing plenty of inspiration in the process. We’re taking styling tips and adding outfit ideas to our moodboard with a renewed perspective on spring dressing, and you’re going to want to do the same. Scroll on to discover our favorite London Fashion Week Street Style looks, and keep checking back as we’ll continue to update this post throughout the event.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Photographed by Emma Rahmani.Like what you see? author: Michael Kristy from The Iron Snail

title: 13 Comfortable Work Shoes For the Office and Beyond
description: When finding the perfect pair of work shoes, style ranks high on our wish lists but, naturally, so does comfort. From the subway to the office to after-work cocktails with your friends and beyond, these are the shoes you'll practically be living in daily, so it's important to shop for a pair that'll keep you feeling comfortable, supported, and chic. Ahead, we curated a list of this season's best and most comfortable work shoes for women, from slingback heels and black flats to business-casual shoes that can meet any office's dress-code requirements. Most importantly, they all have one thing in common: they'll become your go-to everyday pair. Depending on your job or daily journey, your comfort (and commute) requirements might have different needs. If you work in a more dressed-up environment with a walking commute, opt for classic, comfortable flats that you can wear with trousers. If your workplace is more casual and you drive, you can probably get away with wearing a pair of heels to spice things up. And, of course, we also made sure to include some versatile sneakers that pair well with all clothing items - and are even favorites of our own editors. Keep reading for our complete guide to the best women's work shoes. With styles from brands like Old Navy, Rothy's, and Everlane, there's something at every price point and markdown. Find your favorites and shop this season's best comfortable work shoes for standing all day.
author: Kyley Warren

title: Kim Kardashian's Skims Butt Padding Is Dividing the Internet - Shop Here
description: Skims went from an idea to an award-winning intimates and loungewear brand. Founded by Kim Kardashian and Jens Grede in 2019, the company was valued at $4 billion in July 2023, according to Forbes. Whether or not shoppers are Kardashian fans, the brand still seems to have go-to collections that continuously sell out. And the latest iteration is "The Ultimate Butt" drop featuring shorts, leggings, and bodysuits with built-in butt pads. Almost as soon as Kardashian announced the new collection on Instagram, fans responded with strong opinions, some praising the campaign rollout ("The marketing is simply genius," one commenter wrote) and others questioning how the shapewear will fare IRL ("and then you take it off to hook up and then what," one critic posted). No matter where you fall on the butt-padding debate, you can't ignore the numbers: most of the drop is already sold out. Some other favorites from Skims? The Skims Fits Everybody line is made with a signature stretch fabric that truly is butter-soft (in fact, I'm wearing the classic thong right now and I describe it as feeling like "nothing." In other words, it's a second skin). The Soft Lounge launch gave way to everyone's favorite long slip dress, which most people attest to be the most flattering body-conscious piece they own. And the Seamless Sculpt range provides every piece of shapewear you could possibly imagine layering underneath that slightly skin-revealing look you've been trying to figure out how to style. And then there's the nipple push-up bra that turns heads whenever I wear it and is a major bestseller. It should come as no surprise that you can now shop these pieces in person. Of course, Skims has been most notably praised for its sizing (XXS-4X) and incredible assortment of nude shades to complement skin tones. Its adaptive products feature added hook and eye closures and front clasps for accessibility, though the brand is overdue for introducing more styles. Nevertheless, if you're new to shopping Skims, we highly recommend you start with the top-rated picks that most folks rave about on social - and the below assortment is it. Ahead, read up on the Skims bestsellers, and decide where to shop based on your color and size preferences. Skims is available online at skims.com, Nordstrom, Saks Fifth Avenue, Net-a-Porter, Ssense, and more.
author: Sarah Wasilak
